title: Thunderbird Problem
creator: ikproudler1
content:
I'm running Thunderbird 138.0.3 (release update channel). I had an update in the past few days and now it is having a problem. Thunderbird starts OK but it I use another program for several minutes when I go back to Thunderbird its window is not visible. Looking at my system monitor Thunderbird is using a lot of CPU. The only way I can proceed is to kill Thunderbird from the system monitor. No crash report is generated. Running in safe mode does not help.

If I run Thunderbird from a terminal I get: $ thunderbird [64132] Sandbox: CanCreateUserNamespace() unshare(CLONE_NEWPID): EPERM ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment.

This seems pertinent as it it to do with graphics but the web seems to suggest it in not important.

I have copied the Troubleshooting information to a text file and so can share it but it is quite large does not seem appropriate to include it here.

Any help gratefully received.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/mozilla-crash-reporter-tb"]

title: Calendar Notifications Stopped for "All Day" Events
creator: jerrylcanterbury
content:
I am no longer receiving calendar notifications for events which are entered as "all day" events on my Google calendar.

I had a similar problem about three years ago when I wasn't receiving notifications for ANY events on my Google calendar. I attempted to solve this problem in a similar fashion by uninstalling/reinstalling Thunderbird then disconnect/reconnecting Google Calendar as discussed in the following link, but the All Day events' notifications still are not appearing.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1397571

As a debugging step/temporary solution (so I don't miss notifications), I have integrated my Google Calendar with Outlook, and am receiving notifications correctly with that app, so the problem doesn't appear to be on the Google end.

title: Filters create blank messages
creator: stu0000000
content:
I recently converted from Outlook to Thunderbird and use a Local Folder to maintain most of my emails. Everything seemed to run well for the first few days, but then I realized most emails being automatically copied by filters are showing up 2 blank messages (same subject/date/time/etc.). I get the occasional 12/31/1969 email as well. Oddly, when I run the filters manually, the process works flawlessly and have never resulted in duplicated blank messages or a 1969 email.

Any opinions on why an automatically-ran filter corrupts most emails but manual runs are fine? The behavior is bad enough I'm considering switching back to Outlook. This is such a basic function it causes me doubt in Thunderbird's ability to safely manage my emails.

Notes: - Using Proton Mail Bridge - Latest Thunderbird/latest Proton Mail Bridge with no add-ons or extensions - Repairing or compacting the associated Local Folder doesn't fix any message. The only 'fix' is to manually re-copy the affected message from my server, then delete the corrupt copies. - The filters are set to run with new email - Each filter copies the message to the Local Folder, then moves the message to the server's Trash. This two-step action is because Proton Mail Bridge does not allow third-party clients to move messages out of the server--if you do this, it orphans the email in their All Mail folder and become a mess to clean up. - After extensive research, I thought my folders were corrupt so I completely rebuilt the Local Folder structure. All messages were moved into new folders and the original folders were deleted. - Each folder is a few hundred MB, total Local Folder size is less than 7GB
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

title: Clicking a link in Thunderbird opens blank tab/window in Firefox, but not in Chromium
creator: mondalealex
content:
I dual boot two Linux OSes (OpenSUSE Tumbleweed, Pop!OS). They both share the same ~/.mozilla/firefox and ~/.thunderbird directories. In Pop, clicking a link in a message opens up a new tab in Firefox. Then I boot Tumbleweed, where the same versions (128 esr, 138.0 release channel) of both clients are installed. Now if I click the "get help" F1 or any https link in TB, a new window opens with "target=_top" rather than "target=_blank". So basically have to copy/paste links into a new tab manually, *but* only in the Tumbleweed instance.

I installed Chromium and set it as default browser. Guess what? Works just great! I guess I could just live with that configuration, only I'd like Firefox to be my default browser. What could I do? I tried all the steps in [guide] and would appreciate ideas or guidance from this forum.

Thanks! Alex
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/hyperlinks-in-messages-not-working"]
